report_title: Fresh Bread & Bakery Goods Wholesaling in the US
executive_summary: Fresh bread and bakery goods wholesalers are somewhat protected from fluctuations in household disposable incomes and business cycles since their products are staples of pantries in most US households. Wholesalers shifted towards retail markets as restaurant demand dropped during the pandemic, which contributed to an overall revenue decline for the industry over the past five years. In particular, fresh bread and bakery goods wholesaler revenue is anticipated to edge downward at a CAGR of 0.5% through the end of 2024 to reach $70.1 billion despite expanding an estimated 0.3% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite an ongoing consolidation trend within fresh bread and baked goods wholesaling, startups and new entrants are still welcomed. These newcomers bring innovative products and new business models and drive competition that benefits consumers and enriches the market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fluctuating Input Prices Remain a Staple
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Wheat and other key inputs, such as sugar and dairy, have exhibited significant price fluctuations in global commodity markets. After wheat prices dropped in 2019, they grew by double digits in 2020, 2021 and 2022. This price volatility can be attributed to various factors, notably weather conditions impacting harvests, global supply chain disruptions, and varying demand because of dietary shifts or socio-economic trends.

Widespread concerns about diabetes and other obesity-related diseases have prompted boosted dietary scrutiny on behalf of both consumers and public health officials during the current five-year period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Demise of Gluten Puts Pressure on Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Following the low-carb trend, gluten-free eating has recently gained popularity among American dieters. In addition to a boost in the number of people with Celiac disease, gluten-free eating has been touted as a way to lose weight and reduce inflammation.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Consumer Demand Will Support Growth as the Economy Expands
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The effects of the pandemic on the economy are still lingering but are expected to taper off over the next five years. While some concerns about a recession are still on the minds of many, consumers are expected to enjoy rising disposable income over the next five years. Combined with growing confidence, consumer spending is set to climb.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Dietary Trends Will Continue Remaining Prevalent
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the gluten-free and low-carb diet trends continue, upstream bread and bakery goods producers will likely invest in research to create products for this new market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Wholesaler Bypass Will Mute Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Through the power of the Internet, the industry's leading retail buyers are learning to bypass wholesalers by directly sourcing fresh bread and baked goods from local bakeries or large-scale baking factories. This process, known as wholesaler bypass, is reshaping traditional supply chains.
As competition intensifies, fresh bread and baked goods wholesalers will continue to exit the industry or get acquired by other wholesalers as their profit drops too low to remain in business.

industry_definition: Companies that primarily perform merchant wholesale distribution of fresh bread and bakery products are included in the category of fresh bread and bakery goods wholesalers. Also, manufacturers' sales branches and offices that segment out their wholesale distribution routes are categorized under fresh bread and bakery goods wholesalers.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

key_trends: Companies provide value through additional services. Many large retailers work with wholesalers to ensure accurate and timely order fulfillment.

Wholesalers are being bypassed. Retailers increasingly purchase directly from manufacturers through online channels, which has pressured wholesalers to drop their prices to justify their presence in the supply chain.
The outbreak of COVID-19 in 2020 led to a dip in consumer spending.
Consumers have expansively sought out higher-priced products, like multigrain, whole wheat and other artisanal options, to the detriment of white bread sales.
Merger and acquisition activity is common among the largest wholesalers.
Wholesalers operate on a regional or local basis.
Fresh bread and bakery goods wholesalers are innovating their product lines, which helps appeal to health-conscious consumers.
The pandemic temporarily shifted revenue channels.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Most revenue earned from this segment is derived from sales to convenience stores and mass merchandisers like Walmart Inc. and Target Corporation, which offer low prices, broad product varieties and convenience.

Fast food restaurants and chain restaurants are very large markets since these industries tend to purchase fresh bread and other baked goods directly from manufacturers or manufacture such products themselves.

Sales to other wholesalers primarily represent subcontracting work, where fresh bread and bakery goods wholesalers collect products within a small area and deliver them to larger wholesalers' warehouses for bulk sale to retailers and other markets.
The primary food manufacturing industries that use fresh bread and bakery goods wholesaling services are also the major inputs for the industry, such as bread producers purchasing baking inputs.
The chains segment, comprised mainly of fast food and other restaurant chains, tends to source a high percentage of fresh bread and baked goods from industry companies.

products_and_services.product_description: Fresh bread and bakery goods wholesalers sell a wide variety of cookie and cake products, including well-known brands like Sara Lee cakes and Nabisco's Oreo cookies. However, concerns over healthy eating have led many consumers to minimize their consumption of these products.

Bread and rolls can be further subdivided into packaged industrial products and unpackaged artisanal bread and rolls. American consumers have been slowly boosting their consumption of unpackaged breads and rolls relative to packaged varieties.

tier_1_suppliers: Cookie, Cracker & Pasta Production in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Coffee & Snack Shops in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Although some bakery products, like bread and flour, are relatively nondiscretionary staples, consumers adjust the quantity and quality of their grocery purchases to suit their disposable income levels.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region, comprising several states, is densely populated primarily because it includes bustling metropolitan areas such as New York City and Philadelphia, major economic hubs.
The coastal nature of the West allows businesses easy access to shipping routes, lowering the cost of moving goods from upstream customers to downstream markets.
The Great Lakes region includes Illinois, Indiana and Ohio. These states are known for large swaths of fertile, rural farmland.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Wholesalers must follow federal and state guidelines to ensure saftety.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Regulatory compliance can be a substantial barrier to entry for new wholesalers.
Cost of attaining product stock, storage space, and facilities can deter companies.
New entrants can gain an edge by providing high-tech solutions.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies provide value through additional services.
Many large retailers work with wholesalers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Having an extensive distribution network is essential to avoid bypass.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases Comprise the Single Largest Cost for Industry Wholesalers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry wholesalers must buy the breads and other baked goods distributed from upstream producers.
The world price of wheat impacts purchase costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While automation removes some labor needs, employees are still needed.

volatility_points.volatility_description: No major individual product segments are particularly volatile.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Health Awareness Drives Development of New Products
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Innovative products cater to health-conscious consumers.

FAQs.question: How does your company maintain a competitive edge in such a crowded industry?
